Token.Abstract: An NSMutableString class extension that provides regular expression replacement methods.
Performs a regular expression string replacement on the receiver.

Parameter.Name: pattern
Parameter.Abstract: The regular expression pattern to match.

Parameter.Name: templ
Parameter.Abstract: The template to use for performing replacements of any matches found in the receiver.

Token.Abstract: Performs a regular expression string replacement on the receiver.

Parameter.Name: pattern
Parameter.Abstract: The regular expression pattern to match.

Parameter.Name: templ
Parameter.Abstract: The template to use for performing replacements of any matches found in the receiver.

Parameter.Name: options
Parameter.Abstract: The options that govern the behavior of the returned regular expression.

Token.Abstract: Performs a regular expression string replacement on the receiver.

Parameter.Name: pattern
Parameter.Abstract: The regular expression pattern to match.

Parameter.Name: templ
Parameter.Abstract: The template to use for performing replacements of any matches found in the receiver.

Parameter.Name: options
Parameter.Abstract: The options that govern the behavior of the returned regular expression.

Parameter.Name: range
Parameter.Abstract: The range of characters in the receiver within which matching will occur. Characters outside this range will not be affected.

Token.Abstract: Performs a regular expression string replacement on the receiver.

Parameter.Name: pattern
Parameter.Abstract: The regular expression pattern to match.

Parameter.Name: templ
Parameter.Abstract: The template to use for performing replacements of any matches found in the receiver.

Parameter.Name: options
Parameter.Abstract: The options that govern the behavior of the returned regular expression.

Parameter.Name: range
Parameter.Abstract: The range of characters in the receiver within which matching will occur. Characters outside this range will not be affected.

Parameter.Name: errPtr
Parameter.Abstract: An optional pointer to storage for an NSError instance. If this parameter is non-nil and an error occurs, *errPtr will be updated to point to an NSError describing the problem.
